title: (x) type on Toronto Blue Jays jerseys - Crille, Eclat {Marc O, Rob Sutton}
content:
I'm trying to identify the typeface used on the backs of the Jays' jerseys, but even more specifically the numbers. I'm doing a d-school project that involves the Jays.

Any help is much appreciated.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 6.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023154544/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%206_0.jpg) | 99.69 KB |
| [TOR\_4606.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023154544/http:/typophile.com/files/TOR_4606.gif) | 28.3 KB |
author: KelsRock

comments.content:
As you probably know, most sports team typography is proprietary or, at the very least, heavily customized.

That said, Crillee will get you pretty close for the numbers:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/crillee-italic/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023154544/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/crillee-italic/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/letraset/crillee-italic/")

It's certainly not the one, but Eclat has a similar feel to the face used for Jays.

[http://www.identifont.com/show?2OZ](http://web.archive.org/web/20131023154544/http:/www.identifont.com/show?2OZ "http://www.identifont.com/show?2OZ")

Rob
